and/or the performance of community service under this administrative process shall not relieve the violator from his
responsibility to correct a violation. (Ord. 2007-21)
20-3-3: COMMUNITY SERVICE OPTION:
Community service shall be available as an administrative remedy under the pay by mail program upon meeting all of
the following requirements:
A. The volunteer must have no prior criminal history or record of committing any offense under municipal, state or federal
law, except for minor traffic offenses (which shall be verified in writing under oath); and
B. The volunteer must submit a nonrefundable administrative fee (as established by resolution) to the city attorney's
office within ten (10) business days from the date of the arrest; and
C. The volunteer must sign and submit all forms and legal documentation with the city attorney's office within ten (10)
business days from the date of arrest; and
D. The volunteer must agree to hold the city, its officials and employees, including any city designated supervising
agency and site, harmless for any cause of action that may arise from any injury or damage caused from or incurred
by the volunteer during the performance of community service; and
E. The volunteer must complete the required number of community service hours within forty five (45) days from the date
the community service option is requested through the city attorney's office. (Ord. 2007-21)
20-3-4: AUTHORIZATION TO USE COMMUNITY SERVICE SITES:
The city is hereby authorized to retain the services, supervision and public or community service programs from sites to
assist the city in the volunteer's performance, supervision, and reporting of public or community service. Such sites shall
be released from any liability for personal injury or damage to property caused by a volunteer in the performance of
public or community service, except for any wilful and wanton behavior or gross negligence onbehalf of the site, its
employees or representatives. (Ord. 98-72)
20-3-5: NO IMPACT ON COURT:
Any administrative fine, fee or community service performed in accordance with the pay by mail program shall not effect,
change, alter or modify the fines that may be levied by a court pursuant to any other section of this code. (Ord. 98-72)
20-3-6: COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER LAWS:
The public or community service provided by the sites in accordance with this chapter shall conform with any law which
may restrict or limit the use of public or community service. (Ord. 98-72)
20-3-7: LIABILITY; IMMUNITY:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=470 847/923
Neither the city, its representatives, officials, employees or any authorized site, nor any official or employee thereof
acting in the course of their official duties shall be liable for any injury, loss or damage a person or property may receive
during the performance of public or community service by the assigned volunteer, nor shall any of the aforementioned
entities be liable for any tortious acts of any person performing public or community service, except for wilful, wanton
misconduct or gross negligence of an employee of the city or the designated sites. (Ord. 98-72)
20-3-8: NO EMPLOYMENT STATUS; COMPENSATION:
No person or volunteer assigned to a public or community service program or site shall be considered an employee for
any purpose, nor shall the city or the site be obligated to provide any compensation to such person. (Ord. 98-72)
20-3-9: APPLICABILITY:
This chapter shall be applicable to ordinance violations which are eligible for administrative remedy as approved by city
council through resolution from time to time, under the city's pay by mail program, and shall not affect, modify or change
the penalties that may be imposed by a court pursuant to any other section of this code. (Ord. 98-72)

The following is a perimeter description of the City of Carbondale, Illinois, located in Carbondale Township of Jackson
County, Illinois. This description includes all property annexed to the City through December 31, 1982. This is not a legal
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=470 848/923
description, but a metes and bounds narrative. It is taken from maps of the City of Carbondale at scales of 1" = 100',
1" = 600', and 1" = 1600', located in the Planning Division offices of City Hall, some of which are updated when any
annexation ordinance is adopted by the City Council of Carbondale.
A reduced copy of a map which follows this metes and bounds narrative isattached for clarification purposes. The point
of beginning and ending is identified on the map. Intermediate points are also identified on the map and in the narrative
for purposes of clarity.

S - South

W - West
ROW - Right of way
All distances are approximations.
